thread.title: Fulham risk losing manager Slavisa Jokanovic to Werder Bremen after contract stand-off
thread.title_full: Fulham risk losing manager Slavisa Jokanovic to Werder Bremen after contract stand-off

author: John Cross
title: Fulham risk losing manager Slavisa Jokanovic to Werder Bremen after contract stand-off
text:
Slavisa Jokanovic is attracting interest from Werder Bremen and Malaga (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get daily   Could   
German giants Werder Bremen are eyeing Fulham boss Slavisa Jokanovic. 
Jokanovic, 48, is getting admiring glances from the Bundesliga outfit as Werder Bremen are enduring a disastrous season and are stuck in a relegation fight. 
Former Watford boss Jokanovic is out of contract at the end of the season and formal talks have yet to begin over a new deal. 
That contract stand-off has also alerted Malaga because Jokanovic has been working wonders at Craven Cottage. The Fulham head coach could leave Craven Cottage on a free next summer (Photo: Rex) 
Jokanovic is getting plaudits for playing some of the most attractive football in the Championship and is doing well on a limited budget. 
Fulham are hoping he will stay but have yet to make serious moves to sign him up to a contract. 
That will be of major concern to Fulham fans who have been impressed by Jokanovicâ€™s progress since he arrived in December 2015, leading the club to safety last season and then making great strides this time. poll loading Will Fulham reach the play-offs? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
